00113 /*  You shouldn't use "using" directives in a header file, but the code gets
00114     nearly unreadable otherwise:
00115     typename std::vector<VecMath::Vector<D> >::iterator i = _X.begin();
00116     And because I'm defining template classes here, code must be written in the
00117     header file anyway.
00118 */
00119 using VecMath::Vector;
00120 using std::vector;
00121 
00122 #include <iomanip>

00124 template <unsigned D> void vertex_data<D>::print() {
00125     std::cerr << _dimension << "-dimensional object: ";
00126     std::string separator = "";
00127     for(typename vector<Vector<D> >::iterator i = X().begin();
00128         i != X().end(); ++i){
00129         std::cerr << separator << *i;
00130         separator = ", ";
00131     }
00132     std::cerr << "\n";
00133 
00134 #   if 1
00135         std::cerr << "Surfaces: \n";
00136         for (unsigned i = 0; i < surface().size(); ++i) {
00137             std::cerr << std::setw(4) << i << " (";
00138             separator = "";
00139             for (uintvec1D::iterator j = surface()[i].begin();
00140                  j != surface()[i].end(); ++j) {
00141                 std::cerr << separator << std::setw(4) << *j;
00142                 separator = ", ";
00143             }
00144             std::cerr << ")\n";
00145         }
00146         std::cerr << "\n";
00147 #   endif
00148 
00149 }

00154 template <unsigned D, unsigned D_> class Project: protected Project<D-1, D_> {
00155     public:
00157         std::vector<VecMath::Vector<D_> > operator()(
00158                 const std::vector<VecMath::Vector<D> > &x,
00159                 double scrW, double camW) {
00160             if (D_ > D) {
00161                 throw std::logic_error("Tried to project to a higher dimension");
00162             }
00163             if (D_ == D) {
00164                 throw std::logic_error("Explicit specialization should be called");
00165             }
00166             if (camW <= scrW) {
00167                 throw std::logic_error("Screen must be closer to object than eye");
00168             }
00169 
00170             std::vector<VecMath::Vector<D-1> > x_proj(x.size());
00171 
00172             for (unsigned i = 0; i < x.size(); i++) {
00173                 double ProjectionFactor = (scrW-camW)/(x[i][D-1]-camW);
00174 
00175                 for (unsigned j = 0; j < D-1; j++)
00176                     x_proj.at(i)[j] = ProjectionFactor*x[i][j];
00177             }
00178             return Project<D-1, D_>::operator()(x_proj, scrW, camW);
00179         }
00180 };
00181 
00183 template <unsigned D> class Project<D, D> {
00184     public:
00185         std::vector<VecMath::Vector<D> > operator()(
00186             const std::vector<VecMath::Vector<D> > &x, double, double) {
00187             return x;
00188         }
00189 };

00197 template <unsigned D> void vertex_data<D>::addSurface(unsigned v1, unsigned v2,
00198                                                       unsigned v3, unsigned v4) {
00199     if (v1 >= X().size() || v2 >= X().size() ||
00200         v3 >= X().size() || v4 >= X().size()) {
00201         throw std::out_of_range("vertex_data<D>::addSurface(): index larger "
00202                                 "than size of vertex array");
00203     }
00204 
00205     uintvec1D tmp;
00206     tmp.push_back(v1); tmp.push_back(v2); tmp.push_back(v3); tmp.push_back(v4);
00207 
00208     if (!checkSurfaceExists(tmp)) surface().push_back(tmp);
00209 }
00210 
00216 template <unsigned D> void vertex_data<D>::addSurface(unsigned v1, unsigned v2,
00217                                                       unsigned v3) {
00218     if (v1 >= X().size() || v2 >= X().size() || v3 >= X().size()) {
00219         throw std::out_of_range("vertex_data<D>::addSurface(): index larger "
00220                                 "than size of vertex array");
00221     }
00222 
00223     uintvec1D tmp;
00224     tmp.push_back(v1); tmp.push_back(v2); tmp.push_back(v3);
00225     if (!checkSurfaceExists(tmp)) surface().push_back(tmp);
00226 }

00231 template <unsigned D> bool vertex_data<D>::checkSurfaceExists(const uintvec1D &newSurface) {
00232 
00233     for (unsigned i = 0; i < surface().size(); ++i) {
00234 
00236 
00237         vector<bool> found_equal_vertex(surface()[i].size());
00238 
00239         for (unsigned j = 0; j < surface()[i].size(); ++j) {
00240             found_equal_vertex[j] = false;
00241             for (unsigned k = 0; k < newSurface.size(); ++k) {
00242                 if (surface()[i][j] == newSurface[k]) {
00243                     found_equal_vertex[j] = true;
00244                 }
00245             }
00246         }
00247         bool surfaces_are_equal = true;
00248 
00258         for (unsigned i = 0; i < found_equal_vertex.size();
00259              surfaces_are_equal &= found_equal_vertex[i++]) ;
00260         if (surfaces_are_equal) return true;
00261     }
00262     return false;
00263 }

00265 template <unsigned D>
00266     std::vector<VecMath::Vector<4> > vertex_data<D>::vertices() {
00267         Project<D, 4> p;
00268         return p(X(), 2., 4.);  
00269     }
